intro: Alseodaphne corneri, commonly known as the Kauri daphne, is a member of the Lauraceae family and is native to New Zealand. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces dark, spherical berries that are an important food source for native birds. Alseodaphne corneri is often found in coastal and lowland forests, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
